definition: to address sb directly by name (idiom)/to address sb by name without using an honorific title (indicating either familiarity or overfamiliarity)
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: He has noted that many women get irritated at being first-named .
sentences.chinese: 他已经注意到许多妇女对别人直呼其名很气愤。

sentences.english: Now we are on the first-name bases.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们可以直呼其名了。

sentences.english: He has noted that many women get irritated at being frist-named.
sentences.chinese: 他已注意到许多妇女对别人直呼其名很气愤。

sentences.english: The frequency of his visits was so great that the staff at the store now greeted him by name.
sentences.chinese: 由于跑得太频繁了，店里的人现在已经对他直呼其名。

sentences.english: In the U.S., usually between hearing children and their parents call them by their names.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，通常能听到孩子和父母之间是直呼其名的。

sentences.english: Even the prime-minister of Norway is most often referred to by first name.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕是挪威首相也经常被直呼其名。

sentences.english: She is on first name terms with the boss.
sentences.chinese: 她跟老板要好得都直呼其名了。

sentences.english: Most old ladies feel annoyed at being first-named by youngsters.
sentences.chinese: 大多数老太太对年轻人对她们直呼其名而感到生气。

sentences.english: I guess I'm still not used to calling my superiors by their first name.
sentences.chinese: 我还是有点不习惯对上司直呼其名。

sentences.english: She will never forget the humiliating experience of being first-named by her son in public.
sentences.chinese: 她永远也不会忘记儿子当众直呼其名的尴尬的经历。

sentences.english: They usually use given names, even at work.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常直呼其名，甚至在工作时也是这样。

sentences.english: They often use first names upon meeting people for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 他们经常在头一次见面时就直呼其名。

sentences.english: " But in the West, "am having its name" in Chinese, than the much wider scope.
sentences.chinese: 但在西方，“直呼其名”比在汉语里的范围要广得多。

sentences.english: I guess I'm still not used to calling my superiorsby their first name.
sentences.chinese: 我还是有点不习惯对上司直呼其名。

definition: literary name (an alternative name of a person stressing a moral principle)/courtesy name
honorific (e.g. in grammar of oriental languages)
seniority in the family or clan/position in the family hierarchy
to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
to put on airs/to assume great airs
